messages.title: Your Choice at This Election
messages.content: Standing up to the SNP. Strong, stable leadership for the United Kingdom.
Economic Uncertainty with Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP dragging us back to the division of another independence referendum.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Oppose the SNP's Plans for Another Independence Referendum
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Make devolution work and not pursue the constant constitutional wrangling and 'grievance' of the SNP.
Ensure resources to meet needs, especially in mental health provision, and focus on reducing waiting times and improving existing standards under the SNP.
Back local enterprise to keep the economy growing and increase employment opportunities and living standards.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour and the Lib Dems can't win here. Can stop the SNP here in Edinburgh West.

issues.health: Protect the NHS budget to ensure this critical service gets the resources it needs, especially in mental health provision, and focus on reducing waiting times and improving existing standards under the SNP.
issues.labourEmployment: Jobs! Jobs! Jobs! Back local enterprise to keep the economy growing and increase employment opportunities and living standards.

community.content: Oppose the SNP's plans for another independence referendum, make devolution work and not pursue the constant constitutional wrangling and 'grievance' of the SNP.

endorsements.endorsement: I was a Liberal Democrat Councillor for Almond ward in Edinburgh West but am now backing Sandy Batho and the Scottish Conservatives as the effective force to stand up to Nicola Sturgeon & the SNP and say they don’t want a second independence referendum.

I voted Liberal Democrat at the last election, but I’m backing Sandy Batho and the Conservatives now as they’re the only ones who can stop the SNP. Sandy Batho is a local candidate that we can trust to focus on local issues such as education and policing.

quotes.text: The facts locally are that Labour or Lib Dems cannot win here and the only way to challenge SNP is by voting Scottish Conservatives.
People have said time and again that they do not want to go back to the division of a second referendum, but the SNP aren’t listening.

examples: Panelbase poll, Sunday Times Scotland, 23 April 2017 - SNP 44%, Con 33%, Lab 13%, LibDem 5%.
Scottish Daily Express, 20 March 2017: Poll rejects Sturgeon's plan for new referendum.
Standing up to the SNP. Strong, stable leadership for the United Kingdom.
Economic Uncertainty with Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP dragging us back to the division of another independence referendum.
Together we can send Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP a message they can’t ignore.
Local enterprise to keep the economy growing.
Local issues such as education and policing.
Protect the NHS budget.
Oppose the SNP’s plans for another independence referendum.
Labour and the Lib Dems can't win here.
Strong, stable leadership for the United Kingdom.
Economic Uncertainty with Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP dragging us back to the division of another independence referendum.
People have said time and again that they do not want to go back to the division of a second referendum, but the SNP aren’t listening.
Make devolution work.

personalStories.story: Alastair Shields was a Liberal Democrat Councillor for Almond ward in Edinburgh West but is now backing Sandy Batho.
Carole Welch voted Liberal Democrat at the last election, but is now backing Sandy Batho and the Conservatives.
